Author: Zanzarismo#6500
Content: Hello! I have a troubleshooting issue üòá

Author: Zanzarismo#6500
Content: So I've just imported some dev funds for DigitalPrice onto the Verus Agama wallet, fully synced and everything. But my balance remains zero in my wallet, despite the explorer showing many more..?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Zanzarismo check that you aren't on a fork, check that `validateaddress <address>` shows "ismine" as true

Author: Zanzarismo#6500
Content:
CLI response:

{ "isvalid": true, "address": "RVH4EJRNKF8M6vDsBMPBgsw4UvFYVfhiSS", "scriptPubKey": "76a914db5bf6cc01309335b35f320ecf36ce73121060dc88ac", "segid": 21, "ismine": true, "iswatchonly": false, "isscript": false, "pubkey": "021e83abc9a25c0dd66a87d6643232b6b0b7adf6f3cf62d8452c323940cef7fb21", "iscompressed": true, "account": "" }

Author: Zanzarismo#6500
Content: So the "ismine" is true, üòÖ I'm stuck still üòÅ

Author: Zanzarismo#6500
Content: Should I restart the wallet?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: did you try to rescan manually? do that, and if still 0 then reindex, funds are on chain so your chain data is not correct.

Author: Zanzarismo#6500
Content: To rescan manually, you just validate the address, no?

Author: Zanzarismo#6500
Content: Yay! I got it

Author: Zanzarismo#6500
Content: Thanks guys :)

Content: Does Agama have a self update function or do I have to download from the site each time? I'm worried about trusting verus, why do you guys trust them so much?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
> Does Agama have a self update function or do I have to download from the site each time?
you have to download from the site everytime

> I'm worried about trusting verus, why do you guys trust them so much?
they are an ecosystem project, the repos are open source, the founders are public and have a good relationship with our project

We will have our own desktop litewallet when AtomicDEX desktop is released, till then, ocean qt wallet is developed by Komodo team and can be used for desktop native
@steinsg8

Author: Arno#3334
Content: I hope someone from the Komodo team with technical knowledge and access rights can help. In a failed atomicDEX trade, me being the maker, the trade timed out at step 2/3 resulting in my funds (KMD) having been sent into an address starting with "b...", but since the swap failed I have not received the other coins. In the telegram they told me just to wait for 4 hours for an automatic refund, but now almost 6 hours have passed without any result. How can I get my funds back?

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Who has / where is the private key to that "b..." address to make a refund possible?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Its a multisig addr I believe, not sure how to unlock, but its possible. Best to wait for teammember to assist üôÇ

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: @Arno  refund will come automatically. If not, you will see an "unlock funds" button in the history.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: May I ask what coins did you swap?

Author: Arno#3334
Content: sell KMD, buy DEX

Author: Arno#3334
Content: But how long will it take?

Author: riseandfall#3726
Content:
Hello,
I have some KMDs on a ledger but I can't transfer them. Ledger live (ledger software wallet) says that the transaction failed.  (So they are blocked there üòí)
I so want to import my seed to agama wallet. But my seed is 24 words +an additional passphrase (this is a feature of BIP39 AFAIK)
My question is : Will it work if I enter in Agama wallet  25 (24 + 1) words ?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
Normally it's 4 hours @Arno  sometimes a bit more, only the multisig address can unlock the funds for you, either automatically after some time, or you manually pressing the "unlock funds" button in atomicdex in case the swap was stuck. 
Wait a bit more and if it doesn't unlock please send your swap log (settings > share log)  to TonyL or gcharang
